Author: Buddhism
Text: Do actions that are unpleasant but give good results and don’t do actions that are pleasant but give bad results.

Author: Buddha
Text: Lead by nonviolence, righteousness, and equity.

Author: Buddha
Text: Actively discern good from evil and choose good.

Author: Field of psychology
Text: Recognize the limits of your knowledge.

Author: Field of psychology
Text: Pay attention to context and the bigger picture.

Author: Field of psychology
Text: Integrate different perspectives of a situation.

Author: Baltes And Colleagues
Text: Assess the consequences of an action for yourself and others.

Author: Field of psychology
Text: Balance intrapersonal (self), interpersonal (others), and institutional (society) interests.

Author: Grossmann And Kross
Text: Solomon's Paradox: people reflect more wisely on other people's problems than on their own.

Author: Nicholas Maxwell
Text: New knowledge without wisdom can cause both harm and good.

Author: Al-Kindi
Text: We must not be ashamed to admire the truth or to acquire it, from wherever it comes.
